definitions.definition: The price paid for obtaining, or price received for providing, money or goods in a credit transaction, calculated as a fraction of the amount or value of what was borrowed.
definitions.example: Our bank offers borrowers an annual interest of 5%.

definitions.definition: Any excess over and above an exact equivalent
A great attention and concern from someone or something; intellectual curiosity.
definitions.example: He has a lot of interest in vintage cars.

definitions.definition: Attention that is given to or received from someone or something.
An involvement, claim, right, share, stake in or link with a financial, business, or other undertaking or endeavor.
definitions.example: I have business interests in South Africa.

definitions.definition: Something or someone one is interested in.
definitions.example: Lexicography is one of my interests.

definitions.definition: Condition or quality of exciting concern or being of importance
Injury, or compensation for injury; damages.
(usually in the plural) The persons interested in any particular business or measure, taken collectively.
definitions.example: the iron interest;  the cotton interest

definitions.definition: To engage the attention of; to awaken interest in; to excite emotion or passion in, in behalf of a person or thing.
definitions.example: Action films don't really interest me.

definitions.definition: To be concerned with or engaged in; to affect; to concern; to excite.
To cause or permit to share.
The persons interested in any particular business or cause, taken collectively.
